data.title: Disneyland: Mars and Beyond (1957)
data.meta_description: Directed by renouned animator Ward Kimball, ' Mars and Beyond' is a lighthearted exploration of the history and future of Space Travel as understood back in 1957! Theories from scientists and philosophers are discussed. Focusing on Mars. Ideas from science-fiction authors H.G. Wells and Edgar Rice Burroughs are brought to life with colorful animation. Pulp science fiction comics of the time are parodied. Life on other planets is considered, profiling each of the planets in the solar system from the perspective of what would happen to man on them. A masterpiece of animation and sci-fi that was way ahead of it's time. Ward Kimball was perhaps the most inventive of all Disney animators and probably the only one who admitted to experimenting with psychedelic drugs in the 60's. Also the only animator who Walt Disney ever called a "genius."
data.text:
Narrated by the iconic voice of Paul Frees, Mars and Beyond takes viewers on a speculative journey through the universe, exploring the mysteries of space and envisioning potential future expeditions to Mars. It gives us a particularly fun look through the history of science and exploration, from the primitive views of early astronomers to theories presented by the likes of Wernher von Braun.

The animation itself is a testament to the artistic prowess of the people at Disney and I loved the almost expressionistic style used to depict interplanetary travel, alien landscapes, and speculative Martian life is both visually stunning and conceptually intriguing. The animators skilfully blend science and imagination, creating a vivid portrayal of what was then the cuttingâ€¦
